info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 1:10PM EDT until March 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Dauphin County in south central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Huntingdon County in central Pennsylvania... Juniata County in central Pennsylvania... Mifflin County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Northumberland County in central Pennsylvania... Perry County in south central Pennsylvania... Southern Snyder County in central Pennsylvania... * Until 200 PM EDT. * At 108 PM EDT, a band of dangerous snow squalls was located along a line extending from Middleburg to Mifflintown to Strodes Mills to Franklinville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Newport, Mifflintown, Millersburg, Burnham, Belleville, Lykens, Duncannon, Elizabethville, Highland Park, Middleburg and Honey Grove. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
